intro: Sterigma dentatum, commonly known as the toothed stem plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tooth-like structures on its stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a serrated or toothed margin, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and can be colorful, attracting various pollinators.
